com.amplifyframework.core.category

Class Category<P extends Plugin<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amplifyframework.core.category.Category<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - A base class type for plugins that this category will support, e.g. StoragePlugin, AnalyticsPlugin, etc.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CategoryTypeable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnalyticsCategory, ApiCategory, AuthCategory, DataStoreCategory, HubCategory, LoggingCategory, PredictionsCategory, StorageCategory

    public abstract class Category<P extends Plugin<?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements CategoryTypeable
    A category groups together zero or more plugins that share the same category type.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Category()
      Constructs a new, not-yet-configured, Category.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public final void configure(CategoryConfiguration configuration,
                            android.content.Context context)
                     throws AmplifyException
        Configure category with provided AmplifyConfiguration object.
        Parameters:
        configuration - Configuration for all plugins in the category
        context - An Android Context
        Throws:
        AmplifyException - if already configured

      • initialize

        public final CategoryInitializationResult initialize(android.content.Context context)
        Initialize the category. This asynchronous call is made only after the category has been successfully configured. Whereas configuration is a short-lived synchronous phase of setup, initialization may require disk/network resources, etc.
        Parameters:
        context - An Android Context
        Returns:
        A category initialization result

      • addPlugin

        public final void addPlugin(P plugin)
                     throws AmplifyException
        Register a plugin into the Category.
        Parameters:
        plugin - A plugin to add
        Throws:
        AmplifyException - If Amplify is already configured

      • removePlugin

        public final void removePlugin(P plugin)
        Remove a plugin from the category.
        Parameters:
        plugin - A plugin to remove

      • getPlugin

        public final P getPlugin(java.lang.String pluginKey)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Retrieve a plugin by its key.
        Parameters:
        pluginKey - A key that identifies a plugin implementation
        Returns:
        The plugin object associated to pluginKey, if registered
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the requested plugin does not exist, or has not been configured.

      • getPlugins

        public final java.util.Set<P> getPlugins()
        Gets the set of plugins associated with the Category.
        Returns:
        The set of plugins associated to the Category
